dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, D.C. last night, what a wild scene, right? The sixth night of protests, and it really just escalated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, D C last night, what a wild scene, right? The sixth night of protests, and it really just escalated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it was pretty intense. I mean, the lights at the White House actually went dark, like, around 11 p.m.?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it was pretty intense. I mean, the lights at the White House actually went dark, like, around eleven p.m.?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is just such a visual, isn't it? And then you had the tear gas, the fireworks going off...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just such a visual, isn't it? And then you had the tear gas, the fireworks going off...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as protesters set off fireworks nearby, with police responding by firing tear gas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. And the looting, too. Stores like Target, Sephora, even a liquor store, um, people just smashing windows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. And the looting, too. Stores like Target, Sephora, even a liquor store, um, people just smashing windows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, with baseball bats, from what I saw. And fires, too, I heard the basement of St. John's Church, like, caught fire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, with baseball bats, from what I saw. And fires, too, I heard the basement of St. John's Church, like, caught fire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports, including in the basement of the historic St. Johns Church.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right. And the graffiti, even on the Lincoln Memorial. I mean, it's just... wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right. And the graffiti, even on the Lincoln Memorial. I mean, it's just... wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sites around the National Mall were marked with graffiti, including the Lincoln Memorial, following Saturdays protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just a lot to take in. And President Trump, he's just been kinda out of public sight, hasn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just a lot to take in. And President Trump, he's just been kinda out of public sight, hasn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as President Trump remained out of public sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he did tweet "LAW AND ORDER!" But, uh, apparently he was taken to an underground bunker on Friday night as a precaution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he did tweet L A W A N D O R D E R! But, uh, apparently he was taken to an underground bunker on Friday night as a precaution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol. He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A bunker? Wow. [overlaps] Meanwhile, the National Guard is activated in, like, twenty-one states now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A bunker? Wow. Meanwhile, the National Guard is activated in, like, twenty-one states now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ABC News reported that the National Guard has been activated in 21 states plus Washington, D.C.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a huge response. And, um, speaking of numbers, over 2,500 arrests nationally this weekend, according to reports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a huge response. And, um, speaking of numbers, over two thousand, five hundred arrests nationally this weekend, according to reports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2,564. Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It just really shows, like, the scale of this. And it all goes back to, of course, George Floyd's death.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It just really shows, like, the scale of this. And it all goes back to, of course, George Floyd's death.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. The outrage is just so palpable, especially with everything else going on, the pandemic, the mass unemployment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. The outrage is just so palpable, especially with everything else going on, the pandemic, the mass unemployment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage, coming amid the coronavirus pandemic and mass unemployment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that video, you know, of Derek Chauvin, kneeling on his neck. Just horrific.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that video, you know, of Derek Chauvin, kneeling on his neck. Just horrific.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over after a video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Floyds neck⁠...went viral. The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He's been charged with third-degree murder, and get this, his wife even filed for divorce.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He's been charged with third-degree murder, and get this, his wife even filed for divorce.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, and transferred to state prison. (His wife has also filed for divorce).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Floyd's family wants that upgraded to first-degree. It's just, uh, it's a heavy time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Floyd's family wants that upgraded to first-degree. It's just, uh, it's a heavy time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. A lot of frustration just boiling over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. A lot of frustration just boiling over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over after a video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Floyds neck⁠with three other officers standing by⁠went viral.
